result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Miguel A Pedraza Hernandez

records.addlTxt: Return date on December 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

2:35 PM Defendant Miguel A Pedraza Hernandez appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Annie E Getsinger appeared by video for Miguel A Pedraza Hernandez.  Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and appearances.  DE hasn't applied for PD appt yet.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised rights to an attorney  State makes bail argument - requests $250 cash noting large cash bond out of Illinois.  Atty Getsinger responds - requests signature bond noting DE is being held on the Illinois warrant - DE's address is correct.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  $100.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  none.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Return date scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on October 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on September 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
